alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 11:24PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Buffalo and northwestern Trempealeau Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Elk Mound to near Plum City. This line will produce frequent lightning in northern Buffalo and northwestern Trempealeau counties as they move southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Frequent lightning. SOURCE...Satellite and lightning monitoring network. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Strum around 1200 AM CDT. Modena around 1210 AM CDT. Osseo around 1215 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gilmanton, Maxville, The Big Swamp Area, Tell, Eleva, Mondovi Airfield, Misha Mokwa, Urne, and Lookout. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
